Docs.summary: Provides extension methods on , , and related delegates.

remarks.para: provides methods methods for:
Currying via partial application is a way to easily transform functions which accept N arguments into functions which accept N-1 arguments, by "fixing" arguments with a value.

"Traditional" currying converts a delegate that accepts N arguments into a delegate which accepts only one argument, but when invoked may return a further delegate (etc.) until the final value is returned.
Composition is a way to easy chain (or pipe) together multiple delegates so that the return value of a "composer" delegate is used as the input parameter for the chained delegate:

MemberSignature.Value: public static Action<T1> Compose<T1,T2> (this Action<T2> self, Func<T1,T2> composer);

Docs.typeparam: The return type, and argument type.
Docs.returns: Returns a which, when invoked, will invoke and pass the return value of to .

remarks.para: Composition is useful for chaining delegates together, so that the return value of is automatically used as the input parameter for .

MemberSignature.Value: public static Action<T> Curry<T> (this Action<T> self);

Docs.returns: A which, when invoked, will invoke .

remarks.para: This is the more "traditional" view of currying, turning a method which takes (X * Y)->Z (i.e. separate arguments) into a X -> (Y -> Z) (that is a "chain" of nested Funcs such that you provide only one argument to each Func until you provide enough arguments to invoke the original method).

MemberSignature.Value: public static Action Curry<T> (this Action<T> self, Mono.Rocks.Tuple<T> values);

Docs.param: A value of type which contains the values to fix.
Docs.returns: Returns a which, when invoked, will invoke along with the provided fixed parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Action Curry<T> (this Action<T> self, T value);

Docs.param: A value of type to fix.
Docs.returns: Returns a which, when invoked, will invoke along with the provided fixed parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Func<T,TResult> Curry<T,TResult> (this Func<T,TResult> self);

Docs.returns: A which, when invoked, will invoke and return the value that returned.
